0WdS926WpyiokTv4.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
0WdS926WpyiokTv4.name: Dancing Lights

5nbfijONNe4T5HFM.description:
With a touch, the ghost attempts to drain a living creature's life force. It makes a ghostly hand Strike but deals no damage on a hit.

Instead, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} for 1 day, and the ghost regains [[/r (max(1,floor(@actor.level/2)))[healing]]]{HP equal to half its own level}.
5nbfijONNe4T5HFM.name: Draining Touch

7s2ezouHGaqFCuhW.description:
The ghost stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes @Damage[9d6[void]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:37|basic] save.

A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.
7s2ezouHGaqFCuhW.name: Corrupting Gaze

UdmjBD1i3DxTYEep.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]] damage, subject to a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save.
UdmjBD1i3DxTYEep.name: Telekinetic Assault

iE3cMVqsLzS8aqvH.description:
Releasing the nereid and allowing her to leave this place (or, alternatively, killing her) allows the Gardener to move on to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.
iE3cMVqsLzS8aqvH.name: Rejuvenation

jXwGpQmNRAqEcUQN.description:
Frequency once per day.

If the Gardener's next action is to cast a 6th- or lower level spell, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).
jXwGpQmNRAqEcUQN.name: Quickened Casting

The Horned Hunter.description:
To a satyr, life is a party and everyone is invited. Notorious for their hedonism, these fey believe there's no greater beauty than can be found in song, drink, indulgent meals, and carnal pleasures. Satyrs use their enchanting songs and natural charm to encourage all manner of people to follow their true desires and free themselves from society's rules. This usually involves enticing mortals to join raucous parties or engage in trysts in moonlit glades. If a potential companion rejects a satyr's advances, however, the satyr has little interest in continuing a conversation and goes off to find more amenable revelers.

The lifestyle of a satyr leaves no room for ongoing affairs or long-term friends. Once his party is over or his lust is satiated, the satyr disappears back into the forest. The offspring satyrs leave behind are satyrs themselves, and usually end up being taken from their cradles by other fey rather than being left in mortals' care. Satyrs are always male.

The untouched beauty of the forest is sacred and precious to a satyr. Brutish intruders who clear-cut trees or massacre animals without eating them risk drawing a satyr's ire. A satyr so provoked uses his spells to undermine foes and attempts to dispatch them either with brutal ambushes or by leading a rush of forest animals to attack.

Other fey, particularly good fey, look upon satyrs as loutish, embarrassing cousins. They're rarely hostile toward satyrs, but most find them insufferable and advise any mortals they like to steer clear of satyrs' glades.

AwKlC3yGdtDzjPWM.description: The Horned Hunter's multiple attack penalty for attacks against his hunted prey is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on his second attack in a turn, and -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on his third or subsequent attacks. The first time he hits his hunted prey in a round, he deals 2d8 additional precision damage.
AwKlC3yGdtDzjPWM.name: Masterful Hunter

DrW6hlIWaGCF1pU4.description: When the Horned Hunter rolls a success on a Fortitude save, he gets a critical success instead.
DrW6hlIWaGCF1pU4.name: Juggernaut

GcSM5ZkG8OONvY0G.description: Before she sent him into the Material Plane, Nyrissa used the power of her home within the Fable (see area M7c) to forge a link with the Horned Hunter. During his time on the Material Plane, she can observe the world as if seeing through his eyes and listening through his ears. She cannot bolster the Horned Hunter via this link, and uses it primarily to spy on the PCs and observe their tactics in preparation for what she hopes never occurs-their invasion of Thousandbreaths. If the Horned Hunter claims Briar, the sword causes this link to Nyrissa to end immediately.
GcSM5ZkG8OONvY0G.name: Fey Conduit

ILS10PAagocQkyqT.description: The Horned Hunter designates a single creature he can see or hear as his prey. He gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when he @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} his prey and a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival when he @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} his prey, and he ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within his second range increment against his prey. He can have only one creature designated as prey at a time. If he uses Hunt Prey against a creature when he already has a creature designated, the prior creature loses the designation and the new prey gains the designation. Otherwise, a designation lasts until his next daily preparations.
ILS10PAagocQkyqT.name: Hunt Prey

aiu6dXo1hgLG7wFD.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
aiu6dXo1hgLG7wFD.name: Dancing Lights

h4qPfDnAjrfUEFX6.description:
A satyr's wineskin magically enchants any alcohol inside. With an Interact action, a living creature can imbibe the alcohol and gain a +3 item bonus to Will saves for the following hour. When the wineskin is removed from a satyr's person, the magic remains only until the wine spoils. The wineskin holds up to eight drafts of wine.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.us3KiMrcGM8e6ri3]{Effect: Sylvan Wine (Horned Hunter)}
h4qPfDnAjrfUEFX6.name: Sylvan Wine

hbBhekpAkC55ljY1.description:
Trigger The Horned Hunter Plays the Pipes

Effect The Horned Hunter Steps or Strides.
hbBhekpAkC55ljY1.name: Fleet Performer

jAX00kRCiI1ahLJA.description: The Horned Hunter gains the critical specialization effect for any bow he wields.
jAX00kRCiI1ahLJA.name: Bow Specialist

vius8NahqzVZYRSE.description:
Requirements The satyr is holding a musical instrument.

Effect The satyr plays a melody on his instrument to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} without expending the spell slot and using his music in place of providing the spell's component actions. The spell gains the auditory trait and targets all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:60] instead of its usual targets. A creature that succeeds at its Will save against any spell is then temporarily immune from spells played from that satyr's pipes for 1 minute. Satyrs are immune to this music.
vius8NahqzVZYRSE.name: Play the Pipes

ykE4J2hEBa7gWmVx.description: The Horned Hunter ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain and that caused by a bloom.
ykE4J2hEBa7gWmVx.name: Bloom Step

The Horned Hunter.name: The Horned Hunter

The Knurly Witch.description:
Annis hags are brutal torturers and murderers, delighting in the musical screams and tasty flesh of young creatures and those who are pure of heart. Annis hags are the most direct of all hags, engaging in physical combat and using their change shape ability to hunt rather than to infiltrate and betray humanoids. But an Annis hag takes a grisly trophy from each kill and uses it to sow discord, sending the trophy to one of her victim's loved ones in a way that implicates another family member in the murder. Also known as iron hags, annis hags have iron-like yet flexible flesh that resists edged weapons, and their own touch is the same cold iron that burns the flesh of other hags. This allows them to bully their way to the leadership of hag covens.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.bAjHCeyNcPRqOmLv]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.

1AemwaFBoSAJ1UHj.description:
The hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

3QPsbePLeC83pvHf.description:
This polished black wand has a green gem at the tip, and anyone who looks into it sees a reflection of a grinning skull instead of their face.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency Once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{Execute} at 7th rank.

If the spell slays its target, the corpse releases void energy in a @Template[emanation|distance:20], dealing void damage equal to double the spell's rank (@Damage[14[void]] damage).

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of finger of death of the appropriate rank.
3QPsbePLeC83pvHf.name: Wand of Slaying (7th-Rank Spell)

PG62mZgFRnBReYcw.description: The Knurly Witch has used @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.nzbnTqHgNKiGZkrZ]{Gathering Call} to bind herself to the House at the Edge of Time (area K16).
PG62mZgFRnBReYcw.name: Word of Recall

YmkfgSgetEPoWRKA.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
YmkfgSgetEPoWRKA.name: Religious Symbol of Gyronna

bKPOLbNfdVcrEpjV.description:
Once per day, an annis hag can cause a cage built of cold iron fingernails to spring out of nothingness at a range of up to 30 feet, attempting an @Check[athletics|traits:action:grapple|overrideTraits:true] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} against the target's Fortitude DC; if the target has a weakness to cold iron, the annis hag gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this check.

Unlike a normal Grapple, the annis hag doesn't need to be within reach and can move as she pleases, and a successful attempt lasts until the creature escapes (DC 42), causing the cage to crumble into rust.

Any creature can attempt to destroy the cage by attacking it. It has an AC of 40, Hardness 20, and 80 Hit Points.
bKPOLbNfdVcrEpjV.name: Bonds of Iron

utrBYZarwPMS7ACv.description: When the Knurly Witch rolls a success at a Will save, she gets a critical success instead.
utrBYZarwPMS7ACv.name: Resolve

The Knurly Witch.name: The Knurly Witch
The Knurly Witch.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, resolve

The Lonely Warrior.description:
Jealous guardians of tombs, barrows, and sepulchers, cairn wights usually spawn from necromantic rituals. For those mortals who cannot abide the thought of separation from their earthly possessions, the undead existence offered by transformation into a cairn wight can be tempting. Perhaps as frequently, particularly avaricious and wealthy royalty or merchants seek out victims to transform into cairn wights to guard their precious wealth for all time.

Only in the rarest instances is the greed of a mortal strong enough to spontaneously transform them into a cairn wight without a dark ritual or the intercession of a powerful divine being. On those occasions, however, the resultant wight exhibits unmatched viciousness and likely owns rare treasure indeed.

As guardians of material possessions, cairn wights are supernaturally bound to the armaments they wore during the ritual used to create them. They can spread their necromantic powers into the weapons they wield. A slash from a cairn wight's sword channels life from the victim into the wight.

KTxjm0shb9zyrh0z.description: When The Lonely Warrior damages a living creature with a melee Strike, using an unarmed attack or its bound weapon, The Lonely Warrior gains [[/r 5 #Temporary Hit Points]]{5 temporary Hit Points} and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the cairn wraith increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.
KTxjm0shb9zyrh0z.name: Drain Life

aWo3aVa2XXkGsrLY.description:
Trigger The Lonely Warrior is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The Lonely Warrior makes a Strike before being destroyed. It doesn't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.
aWo3aVa2XXkGsrLY.name: Final Spite

eG5iE2SpiXdvquWh.description:
The cairn wight chants a low, haunting melody. Living creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:50]{50 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

The cairn wight can't chant a new Funereal Dirge for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Funereal Dirge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against drain life.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.8ecPVgMeWDxc4jI4]{Effect: Funereal Dirge}
eG5iE2SpiXdvquWh.name: Funereal Dirge

gixaFzYqsyV9bsLi.description: A living humanoid slain by the Lonely Warrior's weapon or claw Strike rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.ZPjQkKVMi3xoPcU0]{Spawned Wight} after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the Lonely Warrior. It doesn't have drain life or cairn wight spawn and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight. If its creator dies, the spawned wight becomes a full-fledged, autonomous cairn wight; it regains its free will, gains drain life and cairn wight spawn, and is no longer clumsy.
gixaFzYqsyV9bsLi.name: Cairn Wight Spawn

vwnAqdmQtoc2jUsW.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.
vwnAqdmQtoc2jUsW.name: Broken +1 Cold Iron Flaming Bastard Sword

zOBaEVlReAlrAIKE.description:
The Lonely Warrior's funeral dirge is somewhat different from the standard cairn wight dirge: its droning, unnerving chant forces living creatures within 50 feet to attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save. The Lonely Warrior can't chant a new Lonely Dirge for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} by gnawing pangs of loneliness until the end of its next turn.

Failure The target is stupefied 1 for 1 hour.

Critical Failure The target is stupefied 1 for 24 hours and takes a -2 status penalty to saves against drain life.
zOBaEVlReAlrAIKE.name: Lonely Dirge

The Lonely Warrior.name: The Lonely Warrior

The Misbegotten Troll.description:
Some trolls have learned the skills necessary to survive well beyond the typical life expectancy for their kind and rally others to follow their lead. These champions develop a number of talents that make them worthy leaders and potent hunters-namely their abilities to willingly boost the rate of their regeneration and to shake off the acid and fire that would hinder it, not to mention a bestial roar that can send would-be predators scurrying off. Troll kings possess a cunning far beyond their younger kin- they know to keep their allies close, and their enemies even closer. If a troll king so much as suspects that one of its followers is plotting to usurp it, retribution is swift and fatal.

Slavering, cruel, practically invincible brutes: this is the villager's stock description for the dread monsters known as trolls. But words hardly do justice to trolls' capacity for destruction. They are as bloodthirsty as orcs but lacking the discipline, as massive as giants but capable of regenerating wounded flesh in an instant, and as reprobate as ogres but with twice the strength. The only way to really understand the wanton violence of a troll is to experience it firsthand-a fate few would wish even upon their worst enemies.

The first thing that comes to mind when most think of trolls is the creatures' power of bodily regeneration. So potent is this regeneration that the only way to overcome it is to exploit the troll's vulnerability to acid and fire. It is not enough to slay the troll with caustic or flaming weapons, though-even the smallest scrap of a troll's flesh can regenerate into a full-size troll given enough time. The only sure way to eradicate a troll menace is to burn the monster's entire body until nothing remains.

Trolls are solitary hunters, for their wickedness is anathema even to other giants. They occasionally roam in small gangs of two to four, but only when prey is plentiful or a particularly strong counterforce has broached their hunting grounds. In rare instances, an old and powerful troll comes to lead small tribes of trolls. Such "troll kings" possess enough cunning to lead their hordes in devastating raids and massacres, and their presence permanently alters the surrounding ecosystem. A wide variety of trolls exist, from the terrible monster traditionally associated with the name to the water-dwelling scrag and hybrid flood troll. Regional variations exist as well-mountain trolls among stony peaks, for instance, or moss trolls in swampy bayous-but all share the same trademark regenerative powers and insatiable thirst for blood.

3wMfK5zZSqFhhTgs.description:
The troll king unleashes a bestial roar. Each non-troll creature within @Template[emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

This ability doesn't affect his pet black smilodons.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}
3wMfK5zZSqFhhTgs.name: Primordial Roar

8xYRzzHeY6uZztPe.description: The troll king Strides twice in a straight line. It can make up to two claw Strikes during this movement and one jaws Strike at the end of its movement. It can't Strike the same creature more than once.
8xYRzzHeY6uZztPe.name: Unstoppable Charge

9VA9Qjcx5YJxs4P1.description:
The Misbegotten Troll shakes his chain of caged sprites, causing the supernatural cages to amplify their despair. All creatures other than the Misbegotten Troll or his smilodon pets within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save. The Misbegotten Troll can't Jangle the Chain again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Jangle the Chain]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Jangle the Chain for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} by despair.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} by sadness, and then sickened 1 by despair once the stun effect ends.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} by sadness, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} by despair once the stun effect ends.
9VA9Qjcx5YJxs4P1.name: Jangle the Chain

TCbRZkzWxt6vXhCx.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Fear Effects

czVzxuwWmCRLgnuc.description:
Requirements The troll king's regeneration is not currently deactivated.

Effect The troll king regains [[/r 25[healing]]]{25 HP}.
czVzxuwWmCRLgnuc.name: Forced Regeneration

y8OK5g64U5E8qC0q.description: When the Misbegotten Troll attacks with his glaive, it manifests dozens of hooks and spikes along its length and blade. He deals an additional 3d8 piercing damage to any creature he strikes but inflicts @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage to himself with each glaive Strike.
y8OK5g64U5E8qC0q.name: Vicious Ranseur

zDDzvsB3OrJU9QXn.description:
Trigger The troll king takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent} acid or fire damage.

Effect The troll king shakes itself to remove persistent acid or fire effects. The troll king immediately attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check to end the persistent damage that triggered this reaction. If the troll king succeeds at this check, it can immediately use Primordial Roar as part of this reaction.
zDDzvsB3OrJU9QXn.name: Vigorous Shake

The Misbegotten Troll.name: The Misbegotten Troll
The Misbegotten Troll.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. fear effects

The Power of Faith.description: The lingering essence of the dwarven worshippers who established this shrine demand deference to Torag and punish those who don't offer it.
The Power of Faith.hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:27] (trained) to calm the lingering essence, @Check[religion|dc:23] (expert) to perform the required obeisance, or @Check[thievery|dc:30] (expert) to disrupt and redirect the essence harmlessly.
The Power of Faith.hazardReset: The haunt deactivates as soon as no living creatures are in area A4, then resets after 1 hour has passed. It can be permanently destroyed by clearing the fortress of all creatures that don't follow Torag and rededicating it to the god with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual.
The Power of Faith.hazardRoutine:
(3 actions; divine, enchantment, mental) Ghostly images of chanting dwarves float through the room, drifting between the creatures in the chamber. As they float, they use their 3 actions to target up to three different creatures in the room, touching their brows and filling that person's head with overwhelming but entirely mental choirs exalting the glory of Torag. The haunt targets @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creatures before other creatures, and a single creature cannot be targeted more than once per round. A targeted creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|traits:divine,enchantment,mental] save; prone creatures take a -2 penalty on this saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[1d10[mental]] damage from the cacophonous choir in their head.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[mental]] damage from the cacophonous choir in their head.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[(3d10+18)[mental]] damage from the cacophonous choir in their head and is knocked prone.
The Power of Faith.name: The Power of Faith

4mK32Hq1EHPgHPW4.description: The Stag Lord capitalizes on his enemies' fear; any creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against his attacks.
4mK32Hq1EHPgHPW4.name: Dread Striker

5UTWzAXIsjMqThHw.description: The Stag Lord lines up a shot and then attempts a ranged Strike against a hunted prey. On this strike, he treats the target as if they were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.
5UTWzAXIsjMqThHw.name: Unfair Aim

Ekik19hqrAXIezul.name: Lock of green hair bound with red twine

HKEKbaIpMla2LGS8.description: The Stag Lord deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

N7BomXiXSkV8IDmE.description: The Stag Lord is in a constant cycling state of being drunk or hungover. As a result, he is constantly @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and cannot reduce his sickened state to lower than 1 (although if effects increase his sickened value, he can reduce them back toward 1 as normal). The Stag Lord can willingly ingest food and drink (including potions and elixirs) while sickened. The values in this stat block have been adjusted to account for his sickened state.
N7BomXiXSkV8IDmE.name: Perpetual Hangover

iS8xyvXyTp2O8SbR.description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r (2d8+5)[healing]]]{2d8+5 Hit Points}.

vn70BPKBAe7Oxy27.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

The Wriggling Man.description: This worm that walks was a cultist of the Great Old One Hastur in its prior life. It continues its conspiracies and strives to further its evil plots in its new life.

49xv61tdfV6J6P29.description:
When the worm that walks is reduced to 0 HP, it discorporates and the component worms that make up its body disperse in every direction. If even a single worm escapes, the worm that walks will eventually re-form using a process that typically takes [[/br 1d10 #Re-Form]]{1d10 days}.

While the exact circumstances and surroundings determine how long the worm that walks's foes have to dispatch the fleeing worms before they escape, usually its foes have only a single round. Typically, this requires the application of an area effect or splash weapon within 1 round to the space where the worm that walks collapsed. After any amount of area or splash damage is dealt to that space, the character dealing the damage must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. Each subsequent area or splash damage effect performed on the area reduces the DC of this flat check by 2, to a minimum of DC 5. If any of these flat checks succeed, none of the worms escape, and the worm that walks is destroyed permanently.

At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or otherwise detaining the vermin may extend the time allowed to finish off the worm that walks.
49xv61tdfV6J6P29.name: Discorporate

DfyikbxEMRuzW77m.description: The worm that walks collapses into a shapeless swarm of worms. It drops all held, worn, and carried items. While discorporated, the worm that walks can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but it can move through areas small enough for its individual worms to fit without having to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze}. It can use the same action to coalesce back into its normal form.
DfyikbxEMRuzW77m.name: Swarm Shape

JITeBuRsssw3rWnW.description:
Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

Capacity 150 Bulk
JITeBuRsssw3rWnW.name: Bag of Holding (Type IV)

N33q9IKpLQA3SIWa.description:
A glass orb atop this metal staff contains fine, undulating sand. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to identify transmutation magic.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.AUctDF2fqPZN2w4W]{Sigil}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aEM2cttJ2eYcLssW]{Fleet Step}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form}
  • 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.RvBlSIJmxiqfCpR9]{Feet to Fins}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}
  • 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.McnPlLFvKtQVXNcG]{Shape Stone}
  • 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form}
  • 6th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Cursed Metamorphosis}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5c692cCcTDXjSEzk]{Dragon Form}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.znv4ECL7ZtuiagtA]{Petrify}

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.
N33q9IKpLQA3SIWa.name: Staff of Transmutation (Major)

eQQryZfmKwV4meJL.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect When the Wriggling Man casts a spell of 8th level or lower, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).
eQQryZfmKwV4meJL.name: Quickened Casting

jU73I507kdECl13G.description:
Trigger The Wriggling Man is reduced to 50 or fewer HP

Effect @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}, heightened to 5th level, teleports the Wriggling Man to area M6.
jU73I507kdECl13G.name: Contingency

n1fjlb5osV2yl7as.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

v8SNi9PIcQFCpAVP.description:
You disguise the targets as other creatures of the same body shape and roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds). The disguise can hide the targets' identities or let them appear to be of another ancestry, but it's not precise enough to impersonate specific individuals. The spell doesn't change voice, scent, or mannerisms. You choose the disguise for each target; for example, you could make one target appear to be a dwarf and another an elf. Casting veil counts as setting up a disguise for the purpose of the Impersonate action. It allows the target to ignore any circumstance penalties they might take for being disguised as dissimilar creatures, and it gives the targets a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through their disguises, and add their level even if untrained. You can Dismiss any or all of these disguises.

Heightened (5th) The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (7th) The targets can appear as any creature of the same size, even specific individuals. You must have seen an individual to reproduce their appearance. The spell also disguises the targets' voices and scents; it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.
v8SNi9PIcQFCpAVP.name: Veil

yGkx5YIsqb7P1b34.description:
Trigger The wriggling man's turn begins.

Effect The Wriggling Man immediately gains the effects of the Sustain a Spell action, allowing him to extend the duration of an active spell.
yGkx5YIsqb7P1b34.name: Effortless Concentration

zNeDe02hwHzcyE1s.description: The worm that walks Strides, ending its movement sharing a space with a creature, and deals @Damage[8d8[piercing]] damage to the creature. The creature can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save.
zNeDe02hwHzcyE1s.name: Squirming Embrace

The Wriggling Man.name: The Wriggling Man

0TyxIsxCmJlWFTk6.description: When the disciple rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.
0TyxIsxCmJlWFTk6.name: Evasion

4WbCPkQrjR5xvIUs.description: The disciple's Strikes force the creature hit to endure a deluge of unfamiliar memories from a combination of past lives and parallel existences, causing an additional 3d6 mental damage with a successful hit.
4WbCPkQrjR5xvIUs.name: Temporal Strikes

7pIVt1wT5IWY1dOP.description:
Frequency Once per turn

Effect The disciple makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damages for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. The disciple's multiple attack penalty applies normally to these Strikes.
7pIVt1wT5IWY1dOP.name: Flurry of Blows

9a3n2YfibJlQxctv.description: The removal of the eyes symbolized a Thresholder's abandonment of all they had seen before, and with the ritual's completion they gain something greater than mere vision: they gain the Unseen Sight. This is a precise sense that mimics darkvision yet functions even if the eye sockets themselves are covered. More importantly, the unseen sight allows a Thresholder to see the truth of the world, granting them the ability to see things as they actually are as if they were under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight}, provided they are located within a region under the influence of Yog- Sothoth.
9a3n2YfibJlQxctv.name: Unseen Sight

LykMqGjDR8Qx8xgf.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (8d6+21)[healing]]]{8d6+21 Hit Points} and gain +3 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.PpLxndUSgzgs6dd0]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Major)}

TxCWNmfsEkdTzNvw.description: The Thresholder Disciple exists outside of time; they don't age, don't need food or drink to survive, and can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} unless they choose to be.
TxCWNmfsEkdTzNvw.name: Outside of Time

ZR6JE7Gh0fgDobEm.description: The disciple takes the stance of the Lurker at the Threshold, full of menace and danger. The disciple can make lurker claw unarmed attacks. These deal 1d12 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the parry, forceful, and unarmed traits. While in this stance, if the disciple succeeds or critically succeeds at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a target, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure) for 1 minute.
ZR6JE7Gh0fgDobEm.name: Lurker Stance

vllPNnBmoSwFEtl9.description: The disciple gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by their movement.
vllPNnBmoSwFEtl9.name: Guarded Movement

yI8AXFiHc0FyemjU.description:
Requirements The disciple is in Lurker Stance

Effect The disciple gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Intimidation checks and their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} attempts don't take a penalty for not speaking the target's language and don't cause the target to become temporarily immune. These effects last until the end of the disciple's next turn.
yI8AXFiHc0FyemjU.name: Ominous Mien

zGifR2PUMCuF3jab.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
zGifR2PUMCuF3jab.name: Religious Symbol of Yog-Sothoth

0bbJhjr4XkyXm2cv.description:
Activate A Interact

A faint mist emanates from your skin, making you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} for 5 minutes.

As usual being concealed when your position is still obvious, you can't use this concealment to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.
0bbJhjr4XkyXm2cv.name: Mistform Elixir (Greater) (Infused)

1CVzuimA1fYyvCBq.description: The Thresholder Hermeticist deals an additional 2d8 bleed damage with melee Strikes. A creature who bleeds for 2 rounds from this becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for as long as it continues bleeding.
1CVzuimA1fYyvCBq.name: Cruel Anatomist

30bEZtUno1F0FNqQ.description:
Activate A Interact

An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +4 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours, and when you drink the antidote, you can immediately attempt a saving throw against one poison of 14th level or lower affecting you. If you succeed, the poison is neutralized.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.1mKjaWC65KWPuFR4]{Effect: Antidote (Major)}

AMuN6VT4RTloaWQk.description: When throwing an alchemical bomb with the splash trait, the Thresholder Hermeticist can deal splash damage to only their primary target instead of the usual splash area.
AMuN6VT4RTloaWQk.name: Bomber

BFpgenVI0pBLyV0S.description: A Thresholder Hermeticist carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time the Thresholder Hermeticist makes their daily preparations: infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jC8GmH0Un6vDxdMj]{Acid Flask (Greater)} (14), infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.kicNrnZz1KjJYRVI]{Eagle Eye Elixir (Major)} (2), infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AmxSqEoFhRLMYd1W]{Elixir of Life (Major)} (3), infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.04giYigfDL5geu5f]{Mistform Elixir (Greater)} (2).
BFpgenVI0pBLyV0S.name: Infused Items

HiL2TCMI2Rzmy2SW.description: When the Thresholder Hermeticist rolls a success on a Fortitude save, they get a critical success instead.
HiL2TCMI2Rzmy2SW.name: Juggernaut

HplaolUyjv0ldmah.description:
Activate A Interact

After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details. For the next hour, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, or +4 when attempting to find secret doors and traps.

Each time you pass within 10 feet of a secret door or trap, the GM automatically rolls a secret check for you to find it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.wyLEew86nhNUXASu]{Effect: Eagle Eye Elixir (Major)}
HplaolUyjv0ldmah.name: Eagle Eye Elixir (Major) (Infused)

TgxTGQ9ZPvKuOKzP.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (8d6+21)[healing]]]{8d6+21 Hit Points} and gain +3 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.PpLxndUSgzgs6dd0]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Major)}
TgxTGQ9ZPvKuOKzP.name: Elixir of Life (Major) (Infused)

XFTxhLhYbwJ3pxdt.description: The removal of the eyes symbolized a Thresholder's abandonment of all they had seen before, and with the ritual's completion they gain something greater than mere vision: they gain the Unseen Sight. This is a precise sense that mimics darkvision yet functions even if the eye sockets themselves are covered. More importantly, the unseen sight allows a Thresholder to see the truth of the world, granting them the ability to see things as they actually are as if they were under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight}, provided they are located within a region under the influence of Yog- Sothoth.
XFTxhLhYbwJ3pxdt.name: Unseen Sight

auvnM9kZNqXdqAIR.description: The Thresholder Hermeticist exists outside of time; they don't age, don't need food or drink to survive, and can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} unless they choose to be.
auvnM9kZNqXdqAIR.name: Outside of Time

cG10UmeLEy9eANOc.description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 3d6 persistent acid damage, and 3 acid splash damage. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.
cG10UmeLEy9eANOc.name: Acid Flask (Greater) (Infused)

uCIO2gyqCCw5HMiZ.description: The Thresholder Hermeticist Interacts to draw an alchemical bomb, then Strikes with it.
uCIO2gyqCCw5HMiZ.name: Quick Bomber

uK2UsNjZ0EK48Nwq.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.
uK2UsNjZ0EK48Nwq.name: Alchemist's Tools

wd4WShZlAcAc3dLe.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
wd4WShZlAcAc3dLe.name: Religious Symbol of Yog-Sothoth

AX9lSAPNk2PJCat1.description: The Thresholder Mystic exists outside of time; they don't age, don't need food or drink to survive, and can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} unless they choose to be.
AX9lSAPNk2PJCat1.name: Outside of Time

FjxVn3oLSCrfIIIz.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
FjxVn3oLSCrfIIIz.name: Religious Symbol of Yog-Sothoth

MeD83DvPWfOBUylm.description:
This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

Currently contains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}

Nzx1vI7LkdpuIwph.description: The removal of the eyes symbolized a Thresholder's abandonment of all they had seen before, and with the ritual's completion they gain something greater than mere vision: they gain the Unseen Sight. This is a precise sense that mimics darkvision yet functions even if the eye sockets themselves are covered. More importantly, the unseen sight allows a Thresholder to see the truth of the world, granting them the ability to see things as they actually are as if they were under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight}, provided they are located within a region under the influence of Yog- Sothoth.
Nzx1vI7LkdpuIwph.name: Unseen Sight

aQsTI9u9o9zMbaHa.description: When the mystic rolls a success on a Will save, they get a critical success instead.
aQsTI9u9o9zMbaHa.name: Resolve

afWpHJ6qqzsRORUX.description: If a reaction would disrupt the Thresholder Mystic's spellcasting action, they attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15]; on a success, the action isn't disrupted.
afWpHJ6qqzsRORUX.name: Steady Spellcasting

gzziZdYQCjJ1pCM1.description:
The mystic reminds their allies of the punishments awaiting those who fail Yog-Sothoth. The mystic and their allies within 60 feet gain a +2 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls until the end of the mystic's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IrXb05caCTkP792e]{Effect: Reminder of Doom}
gzziZdYQCjJ1pCM1.name: Reminder of Doom

Thylacine.description:
A thylacine can be easily mistaken for a dog or jackal, but the defining stripes on their gold-hued backs and unusually wide gaping jaws negate this perception in close encounters. A thylacine is quite vocal, and uses a combination of growls, hisses, and gaping threat-yawns when threatened. An adult thylacine stands 2 feet tall at the shoulder, is 4 feet long (not counting an additional 2 feet of tail) and weighs roughly 50 pounds.

The thylacine is a marsupial carnivore. This nocturnal predator typically hunts alone, only occasionally forming small packs. Because of their odd appearance, thylacines have a far harsher reputation than they probably should, playing a sort of bogeyman role in farming communities.

BxuCFIo6yswNsArJ.description: The thylacine growls, hisses, and bares its jaws in a frightening manner as it attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a creature. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to this Intimidation check, and the attempt is not penalized if the target can't understand the thylacine.
BxuCFIo6yswNsArJ.name: Hunting Cry

Thylacine.name: Thylacine

137OFGe9srUCXPpN.description: The Tiger Lord makes a ranged Strike with a hatchet, then Strides up to twice its speed. If it ends its movement within melee reach of the target of its ranged Strike, it may make a melee Strike against that enemy. If the ranged Strike hit the target, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the melee Strike.
137OFGe9srUCXPpN.name: Closing Volley

ay85G9ub5DX6nf12.description:
Trigger A foe within reach attempts to move away from the Tiger Lord

Effect The Tiger Lord Strides up to its Speed, following the foe and keeping it in reach throughout its movement until it stops moving or the Tiger Lord has moved its full Speed.
ay85G9ub5DX6nf12.name: No Escape

m4LUwAovVkqwRsiG.description:
Requirements The Tiger Lord is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a rage

Trigger The Tiger Lord suffers damage that reduces its Hit Points to 100 or less.

Effect The Tiger Lord flies into a rage that lasts 1 minute. While raging, the Tiger Lord gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. After the rage, the Tiger Lord is fatigued.
m4LUwAovVkqwRsiG.name: Vengeful Rage

8GXdnFtFAY2rCfTj.description:
Requirement The Tiger Lords are routed;

Effect Instead of taking a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.IhjlbJinff1wUSjL]{Retreat} action, the Tiger Lord Berserkers can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.8XXylMGJuqe1ozMk]{Rally}.
8GXdnFtFAY2rCfTj.name: Reactive Rally (Unique)

aEhR1ZQ7MTnP1jll.description: The Tiger Lord Berserkers can use the following Tactical Actions without needing to meet additional requirements: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.Z6jMZgAxI1zRO7Sl]{All-Out Assault}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.8wjiF3ctXUjP9oyX]{Counterattack}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.ggVahjiAlVICpiPA]{Taunt}.
aEhR1ZQ7MTnP1jll.name: Warmongers (Unique)

kCK6XLGlJtVhBcto.description:
Trigger The Tiger Lord Berserkers score a critical hit with a melee Strike.

Effect The barbarians are infused with vigor and furious passion at their devastating blow. The army restores 1 hit point.
kCK6XLGlJtVhBcto.name: Revel in Battle (Unique)

pNUtEJ9t8v2Y17RR.description:
Frequency once per war encounter;

Effect The Tiger Lord Berserkers charge at an enemy army, taking an Advance action to attempt to engage. If the Tiger Lords manage to engage successfully, they can attempt a melee Strike against the army as a reaction.
pNUtEJ9t8v2Y17RR.name: Furious Charge (Unique)

Tiger Lord Hill Giant (TL2).description:
Selfish and crude, these rough-skinned raiders are bullies and ultimately cowards. Quick-tempered and fond of violence, a hill giant gladly raids and pillages the defenseless but is quick to flee from those who are bigger, stronger, or better organized than they are. A hill giant is never above shoving or tricking one of their own kind to slow down their opponent or get the best loot.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They are divided into a number of subtypes.

XU7E8CJIc6dwyRml.description:
Requirements The hill giant's last action was a successful melee Strike

Effect The hill giant's swing drives their enemy back. They push the foe back 5 feet, with the effects of a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}. The hill giant can follow the foe as normal on a successful Shove.
XU7E8CJIc6dwyRml.name: Knockback

xEHY10Oxi5BJJCmQ.description:
The hill giant makes a single greatclub Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within its reach.

This counts as two attacks for the hill giant's multiple attack penalty.
xEHY10Oxi5BJJCmQ.name: Wide Swing

Tiger Lord Hill Giant (TL2).name: Tiger Lord Hill Giant (TL2)

Ww7HmmBMs7a8Dvdq.description: The Tok-Nikrat Scouts stride over watery surfaces, and they ignore difficult terrain caused by water or swamps. They gain a +4 circumstance bonus on initiative checks in war encounters when the battlefield features either terrain.
Ww7HmmBMs7a8Dvdq.name: Water Stride

Z3m0vvyibHXzW8KT.description: If the Tok-Nikrat Scouts hit an army with a net Strike, the army takes no damage. Instead, it increases its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.oVhkdym3D6TiTbrN]{Mired} condition value by 1 (or by 2 on a critical success). An army that is mired as a result of hurled nets can attempt to reduce the value of this mired condition (but not that caused by other sources) by attempting a Battle action against the Tok-Nikrat Scout's Maneuver DC. On a success, the army reduces their mired condition by 1 (or by 2 on a critical success), but on a critical failure, they increase the mired condition caused by the hurled nets by 1. Tok-Nikrat Scouts can't hurl nets at a target army that is distant.
Z3m0vvyibHXzW8KT.name: Hurl Nets

hmfTAGHZXPVAZvaN.description: If the battlefield features water terrain, Tok-Nikrat Scouts gain a +4 circumstance bonus on Maneuver checks made to Disengage.
hmfTAGHZXPVAZvaN.name: Water Retreat

Trapdoor Ogre Spider.description: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants. The placement of their eyes above their wide mandibles evokes the grimacing visage of an ogre's leer. Ogres themselves find the appearance of ogre spider faces simultaneously amusing and adorable, but in most cases, ogres' attempts to keep these spiders as pets result in dead ogres and well-fed spiders.

6qaFJjq9JjlhZbaw.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, clumsy 1, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 4 2d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round).
6qaFJjq9JjlhZbaw.name: Ogre Spider Venom

KXuuj04cishnGNpk.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 25 feet of the spider's lair while the spider is positioned just under the ajar trapdoor and the spider notices the creature

Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Effect The spider Strides or Climbs before it rolls initiative.
KXuuj04cishnGNpk.name: Trapdoor Lunge

v65HAbd7O3gZv2VP.description: A trapdoor ogre spider can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Large creature. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, it can move at its full speed.
v65HAbd7O3gZv2VP.name: Eerie Flexibility

Trapdoor Ogre Spider.name: Trapdoor Ogre Spider

Trapped Portcullis.description: Two portcullises drop down to block progress through this area.
Trapped Portcullis.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to disable the trigger that causes the portcullises to drop
Trapped Portcullis.hazardReset: The trap can be manually reset with a 10-minute Manipulate activity performed in the hallways to the east or west of this area, as long as neither portcullis is broken or destroyed.
Trapped Portcullis.name: Trapped Portcullis

Tree that Weeps.description:
Malevolent, vicious, and cruel, scythe trees pose as normal trees near deep forest paths, where they wait to slaughter passersby. Instead of drawing sustenance from light and soil, scythe trees gorge themselves on the flesh, blood, and bone of sapient creatures. Nothing is more delectable to scythe trees than a kind-hearted gnome or an altruistic dryad who believes that a scythe tree can be redeemed. The screams and whimpers of these victims are music to these cruel plants and add an extra dimension of flavor to the meal.

Scythe trees are solitary creatures by nature, and their size and power mean that they don't need to compete for food with other carnivorous plants. Once food sources dwindle in an area, scythe trees move on to another location. When a scythe tree dwells in a location for many months or years, it leaves traces of its bark and roots in the soil. Over time, these blood-nourished fragments might grow into a new scythe tree, but the progenitor will most likely have already moved on to new hunting grounds long before the new scythe tree reaches maturity.

Scythe trees appear as dead or dying deciduous trees with long, twisted branches that end in scythe-like blades. These carnivorous plants have dark-brown bark that is nearly black near the bottom of the trunk and rusty brown leaves that remain attached year-round. Scythe trees' disturbing mouths remain closed when not eating, appearing as a jagged gash on the trunk. When scythe trees deign to speak, their voices are rough, deep, and mocking, particularly when discussing arboreals, whom scythe trees universally find to be insufferable and worthy of little more than being hacked to pieces.

ALbbJNuSFbicqOfo.description:
Trigger A creature rolls a critical failure on a melee weapon Strike against the Tree that Weepos

Effect The Tree that Weeps attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the creature.
ALbbJNuSFbicqOfo.name: Ripping Disarm

G0x7fr9ZPMuqw2RG.description:
30 feet. Requirements The Tree that Weeps isn't using Dead Tree

Effect A creature that begins its turn in the aura is potentially overwhelmed with despair and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round by despair, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} after recovering from paralysis.

Critical Failure As failure, but the paralysis doesn't end automatically. A character can attempt a new Will save to end the paralysis at the end of their turn; the DC is reduced by 1 each turn that passes.
G0x7fr9ZPMuqw2RG.name: Weeping Aura

VyJyNz5V3NR5Gylr.description: A Tree that Weeps takes 20 additional damage from axes.
VyJyNz5V3NR5Gylr.name: Axe Vulnerability 20

XCr9jxxE59Egb2R1.description:
Requirements The Tree that Weeps is using Dead Tree in forested terrain, and a creature that hasn't detected it is within 30 feet

Effect The Tree that Weeps Strides with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed in the direction of the triggering creature. Once the creature is in reach, the Tree that Weeps makes a scythe branch Strike against it. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against this Strike.
XCr9jxxE59Egb2R1.name: Woodland Ambush

hFDR91zB1cjh1UHv.description: Until the Tree that Weeps acts, it appears to be a dead tree. It automatically takes 43 as the result of its Deception checks and has a Deception DC of 43 to pass as a dead tree.
hFDR91zB1cjh1UHv.name: Dead Tree

Tree that Weeps.name: Tree that Weeps

13OgRHrsWzm9uKgk.description: This kit of bandages, herbs, and suturing tools is necessary for Medicine checks to Administer First Aid, Treat Disease, Treat Poison, or Treat Wounds.
13OgRHrsWzm9uKgk.name: Healer's Tools

22UiypLQhIBbjWDe.description: This manuscript contains scripture of a particular religion. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious text as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious text must be held in one hand to use it.
22UiypLQhIBbjWDe.name: Religious Text of Saranrae

CcZk0BFxjgatzspu.description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r 1d8[healing]]] Hit Points.

LLcHaHnU8lxrhQrT.description: This adds -3 to nature and religion and +1 to HP to match the values printed in the Kingmaker Companion Guide
LLcHaHnU8lxrhQrT.name: Effect: Paizo Adjustment

nOFWQRAuYiD4lmUi.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

w0dVSMMd6B92gewt.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

0KojqA4XVlQ2My16.description: Healing magic purges disease from a creature's body. You attempt to counteract one disease afflicting the target.
0KojqA4XVlQ2My16.name: Remove Disease

13OgRHrsWzm9uKgk.description: This kit of bandages, herbs, and suturing tools is necessary for Medicine checks to Administer First Aid, Treat Disease, Treat Poison, or Treat Wounds.
13OgRHrsWzm9uKgk.name: Healer's Tools

22UiypLQhIBbjWDe.description: This manuscript contains scripture of a particular religion. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious text as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious text must be held in one hand to use it.
22UiypLQhIBbjWDe.name: Religious Text of Saranrae

CcZk0BFxjgatzspu.description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r 1d8[healing]]] Hit Points.

OjU3sC4LCwSAYbfY.description:
Made of smooth, white wood, this staff is capped at each end with a golden cross adorned with a multitude of ruby cabochons. A staff of healing grants an item bonus to the Hit Points you restore anytime you cast the heal spell using your own spell slots or using charges from the staff.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

The item bonus granted to heal spells is +2.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnjhtQYexDtNDdEg]{Stabilize}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnaLVgxZ9ryUFmUr]{Restoration} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo]{Sound Body}
  • 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction}

Q6eK5Vp4nC9xc4pQ.description: Your touch grants a reprieve to a cursed creature. You attempt to counteract one curse afflicting the target. If the curse comes from a cursed item or other external source, a success indicates that the target creature can rid itself of the cursed item, but it doesn't remove the curse from the item.
Q6eK5Vp4nC9xc4pQ.name: Remove Curse

YjsZVkEOo90ZoPjJ.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
YjsZVkEOo90ZoPjJ.name: Wand of Heal (Level 3)

mxTIF80CDuT8kywe.description: This ring grants you resistance 5 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each ring is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a ring of fire resistance might be capped with a ruby, whereas a ring of cold resistance features a sapphire instead.
mxTIF80CDuT8kywe.name: Ring of Energy Resistance (Fire)

nej0EoNsEilLaPwz.description:
These clean, white gloves never show signs of blood, even when used to stitch up wounds or treat other ailments. They give you a +2 item bonus to Medicine checks.

Activate A Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You can soothe the wounds of a willing, living, adjacent creature, restoring [[/r (4d6+15)[healing]]]{4d6+15 Hit Points} to that creature. This is a vitality healing effect. You can't harm undead with this healing.

w0dVSMMd6B92gewt.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

Troll Guard.description:
Some trolls have learned the skills necessary to survive well beyond the typical life expectancy for their kind and rally others to follow their lead. These champions develop a number of talents that make them worthy leaders and potent hunters-namely their abilities to willingly boost the rate of their regeneration and to shake off the acid and fire that would hinder it, not to mention a bestial roar that can send would-be predators scurrying off. Troll kings possess a cunning far beyond their younger kin- they know to keep their allies close, and their enemies even closer. If a troll king so much as suspects that one of its followers is plotting to usurp it, retribution is swift and fatal.

Slavering, cruel, practically invincible brutes: this is the villager's stock description for the dread monsters known as trolls. But words hardly do justice to trolls' capacity for destruction. They are as bloodthirsty as orcs but lacking the discipline, as massive as giants but capable of regenerating wounded flesh in an instant, and as reprobate as ogres but with twice the strength. The only way to really understand the wanton violence of a troll is to experience it firsthand-a fate few would wish even upon their worst enemies.

The first thing that comes to mind when most think of trolls is the creatures' power of bodily regeneration. So potent is this regeneration that the only way to overcome it is to exploit the troll's vulnerability to acid and fire. It is not enough to slay the troll with caustic or flaming weapons, though-even the smallest scrap of a troll's flesh can regenerate into a full-size troll given enough time. The only sure way to eradicate a troll menace is to burn the monster's entire body until nothing remains.

Trolls are solitary hunters, for their wickedness is anathema even to other giants. They occasionally roam in small gangs of two to four, but only when prey is plentiful or a particularly strong counterforce has broached their hunting grounds. In rare instances, an old and powerful troll comes to lead small tribes of trolls. Such "troll kings" possess enough cunning to lead their hordes in devastating raids and massacres, and their presence permanently alters the surrounding ecosystem. A wide variety of trolls exist, from the terrible monster traditionally associated with the name to the water-dwelling scrag and hybrid flood troll. Regional variations exist as well-mountain trolls among stony peaks, for instance, or moss trolls in swampy bayous-but all share the same trademark regenerative powers and insatiable thirst for blood.

3wMfK5zZSqFhhTgs.description:
The troll guard unleashes a bestial roar. Each non-troll creature within @Template[emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}
3wMfK5zZSqFhhTgs.name: Primordial Roar

czVzxuwWmCRLgnuc.description:
Requirements The troll guard's regeneration is not currently deactivated.

Effect The guard king regains [[/r 20[healing]]]{20 HP}.
czVzxuwWmCRLgnuc.name: Forced Regeneration

rTLmI9nr5Sji2tZD.description: The troll guard has access to axe critical specialization effects.
rTLmI9nr5Sji2tZD.name: Axe Critical Specialization

xZwLtaE6SEA50Rqf.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The troll guard lashes out at two foes with its axes. The troll guard attempts two battleaxe Strikes, each of which must target a different foe within reach. These attacks count toward the troll's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the troll makes both attacks.
xZwLtaE6SEA50Rqf.name: Twin Chop

zDDzvsB3OrJU9QXn.description:
Trigger The troll guard takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent} acid or fire damage.

Effect The troll guard shakes itself to remove persistent acid or fire effects. The troll guard immediately attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15] check to end the persistent damage that triggered this reaction. If the troll guard succeeds at this check, it can immediately use Primordial Roar as part of this reaction.
zDDzvsB3OrJU9QXn.name: Vigorous Shake

Troll Guard.name: Troll Guard

a6FAJSwLzdqWyr1E.description: The Troll Marauders can use the All-Out-Assault action. When they do, an army damaged by the assault must succeed at a DC24 Morale check to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.7LMDwpVijK7x5Jst]{shaken 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.7LMDwpVijK7x5Jst]{shaken 2} on a critical failure) as a result of the brutality of this attack.
a6FAJSwLzdqWyr1E.name: Brutal Assault

jn0QB3sq8yQTujyd.description: The Troll Marauders can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.ggVahjiAlVICpiPA]{Taunt} tactical action. When they do, they gain a +2 status bonus on their Morale check if they used the Regeneration tactic this turn.
jn0QB3sq8yQTujyd.name: Frightening Foe

nRUQZPAnP2YUPGdC.description:
At the beginning of its turn, the Troll Marauders regain 1 Hit Point. The Troll Marauders cannot be destroyed as usual unless they lose this tactic. The PCs can cause the trolls to lose the Regeneration tactic via prepared firepots (see Kingmaker page 296); while the trolls' Regeneration tactic is lost, their RT increases to 3.

Otherwise, an army that engages the Troll Marauders while they are defeated can take a three-round action to burn the trolls and destroy their army.
nRUQZPAnP2YUPGdC.name: Regeneration

Tulvak.description: Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.bAjHCeyNcPRqOmLv]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.

4n19omVeZZAAGXBk.description:
A green hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangling Flora}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns} to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

7U6UI5kFLVfm6p1i.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
7U6UI5kFLVfm6p1i.name: Dancing Lights

8W67Bxaonilv5KO0.description:
The green hag exhales a miasma of green vapors. Each living creature in a @Template[cone|distance:15] is affected by her enfeebling humors (attemping a save as normal).

She can't use Exhale Miasma again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Exhale Miasma]]{1d4 rounds}.
8W67Bxaonilv5KO0.name: Exhale Miasma

9S7ODMh2ZM6NXVpF.description: A creature damaged by a hag's claw must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 day.
9S7ODMh2ZM6NXVpF.name: Enfeebling Humors

LxhUmOCBKZi7FNfa.description: The green hag touches a creature that doesn't realize the hag is an enemy. The betrayed creature is affected by the hag's enfeebling humors and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to their saving throw against that effect.
LxhUmOCBKZi7FNfa.name: Betraying Touch

ZYFSO8d8sBeN7WO7.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger Tulvak uses Change Shape to assume her natural shape

Effect Tulvak's transformation into her true form is particularly revolting and can sicken those who aren't prepared for it. All creatures within 30 feet of Tulvak when she takes this reaction must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
ZYFSO8d8sBeN7WO7.name: Unsettling Revelation

aTtxivkD4mgfosfH.description:
The green hag can take on the appearance of any Medium humanoid woman. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

hZbArhODPV9EmZ0m.description: A green hag who succeeds at a Deception check to Lie can mimic the sounds of any animal found near her lair. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.
hZbArhODPV9EmZ0m.name: Sound Imitation

Tulvak.name: Tulvak
Tulvak.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

DMfCBeXGOxuaHuPv.description:
The Riders trample an enemy army. They attempt a Maneuver check against a target non-engaged army's Maneuver DC. Trampling Charge does not trigger @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.8wjiF3ctXUjP9oyX]{Counterattack} reactions.

Critical Success The target army takes 2 points of damage and increases their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.7LMDwpVijK7x5Jst]{Shaken} value by 1.

Success The target army takes 1 point of damage.

Failure The target army takes 1 point of damage. The Tusker Riders are now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.2IqM1XHELKwARAx1]{Engaged} with the target army.

Critical Failure The Tusker Riders are now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.2IqM1XHELKwARAx1]{Engaged} with the target army and are off-guard until the start of their next turn.
DMfCBeXGOxuaHuPv.name: Trampling Charge

UO4ZrO70143knKB5.description: The Tusker Riders can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.Z6jMZgAxI1zRO7Sl]{All-Out Assault}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.GIbm9qo8VuFgPywJ]{Covering Fire}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.kingmaker-features.Item.ggVahjiAlVICpiPA]{Taunt} tactical actions.
UO4ZrO70143knKB5.name: Tusker Training

Unstable Pit.description: This open pit was once covered with branches- it's now visible, but its unstable edges are not obvious.
Unstable Pit.name: Unstable Pit

8PbktFIjqpi9Ht96.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

h2u4wNZQyWuzMUiE.description:
Activate A Interact

After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant.

Benefit You gain a +2 item bonus to Fortitude saves and 10 temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points.

Drawback You take a -2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks and initiative rolls.

Duration 10 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.fUrZ4xcMJz0CfTyG]{Effect: Juggernaut Mutagen (Moderate)}

wj4CE30D9UOTGTJU.description: Changes shortbow to 1d8 to match the values printed in the Kingmaker Companion Guide
wj4CE30D9UOTGTJU.name: Effect: Paizo Adjustment

7jggmf8tCdCFmM8v.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (3d6+6)[healing]]]{3d6+6 Hit Points} and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.EpB7yJPEuG6ez4z3]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Lesser)}

8PbktFIjqpi9Ht96.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

OLgE1eKYfChrP7ip.description: This ring grants you resistance 5 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each ring is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a ring of fire resistance might be capped with a ruby, whereas a ring of cold resistance features a sapphire instead.
OLgE1eKYfChrP7ip.name: Ring of Energy Resistance (Fire)

dUP28SEAU1qLNsa2.description: Changes composite shortbow to 1d8 base die instead of 1d6 and subtracts 2 damage to match the values printed in the Kingmaker Companion Guide
dUP28SEAU1qLNsa2.name: Effect: Paizo Adjustment

h2u4wNZQyWuzMUiE.description:
Activate A Interact

After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant.

Benefit You gain a +2 item bonus to Fortitude saves and 10 temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points.

Drawback You take a -2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks and initiative rolls.

Duration 10 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.fUrZ4xcMJz0CfTyG]{Effect: Juggernaut Mutagen (Moderate)}

Vicious Army Ant Swarm.description: An army ant swarm is a terrifying carpet of stinging insects that devours all in its path.

54mSt8tnFXfSUjhU.description:
Trigger A creature leaves the swarm's space

Effect The swarm takes [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} as ants cling to the creature and continue biting, dealing @Damage[7d6[persistent,piercing]] damage. High winds or immersion in water reduces the DC of the flat check to end this persistent damage to 5. Any area damage dealt to the creature destroys these clinging ants.
54mSt8tnFXfSUjhU.name: Cling

H9cKHc9OAHiXKDzf.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[7d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:31|basic] save). A creature that fails its save against Swarming Bites becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round. If the creature attempts a concentrate or manipulate action while affected, it must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or the action is lost; roll the check after spending the action, but before any effects are applied.
H9cKHc9OAHiXKDzf.name: Swarming Bites

Vicious Army Ant Swarm.name: Vicious Army Ant Swarm

Vilderavn Herald.description: In its true form, a vilderavn herald is a human-sized raven. Its ability to assume a humanoid guise suits it to insinuate itself into the retinue of a mortal ruler or to travel without too much concern, but more often these deadly fey directly serve more powerful rulers, such as the Eldest.

7ZhJ9zRnsiGY2LMq.description: The vilderavn takes on the shape of a wolf or dire wolf, a wolf-raven hybrid, or its raven knight form: a Small or Medium humanoid in black full plate carrying a greatsword. The vilderavn can use its jaws attack only in a form that has a wolf's head, its talon attack only in a form that has raven talons, and its greatsword only in raven knight form.

LZhDKd6gpJJ5o2RO.description:
30 feet. @Check[will|dc:35]

As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Frightful Presence}, plus a creature frightened by the aura becomes suspicious: it doesn't count any other creature as its ally, and it can't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} or flank. On a critical failure, the creature also can't be a willing target for harmless or helpful magic. The vilderavn can activate or deactivate this aura using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3oF2DVXCmJ7VloBb]{Effect: Aura of Disquietude}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]
LZhDKd6gpJJ5o2RO.name: Aura of Disquietude

ao5De1dHxQjNJ8za.description: If the vilderavn kills a humanoid target with a critical hit using its jaws Strike, it rips out and devours the target's heart and soul as part of the attack. While the target is dead, the vilderavn can Change Shape into the target's form, gaining a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to impersonate the target. If magic would resurrect the creature, the caster must succeed at a DC 38 counteract check to extract the target's soul from the vilderavn; otherwise the spell fails.
ao5De1dHxQjNJ8za.name: Souleater

dWpKdYaRxbAJiHSi.description: A creature hit by a vilderavn's melee attack becomes cursed, taking @Damage[2d6[bleed]] damage that's difficult to stanch: the DC to stop the bleeding using Administer First Aid is 35, and healing the creature to full HP doesn't automatically end the bleeding. Removing the curse ends the bleeding.
dWpKdYaRxbAJiHSi.name: Bloodbird

Vilderavn Herald.name: Vilderavn Herald
